Register.Name: SSCR
Register.Description: LTDC Synchronization Size Configuration Register This register defines the number of Horizontal Synchronization pixels minus 1 and the number of Vertical Synchronization lines minus 1. Refer to Figure 82 and Section 16.4: LTDC programmable parameters for an example of configuration.

BitField.Name: HSW
BitField.Description: Horizontal Synchronization Width (in units of pixel clock period) These bits define the number of Horizontal Synchronization pixel minus 1.

BitField.Name: VSH
BitField.Description: Vertical Synchronization Height (in units of horizontal scan line) These bits define the vertical Synchronization height minus 1. It represents the number of horizontal synchronization lines.

Register.Name: BPCR
Register.Description: LTDC Back Porch Configuration Register This register defines the accumulated number of Horizontal Synchronization and back porch pixels minus 1 (HSYNC Width + HBP- 1) and the accumulated number of Vertical Synchronization and back porch lines minus 1 (VSYNC Height + VBP - 1). Refer to Figure 82 and Section 16.4: LTDC programmable parameters for an example of configuration.

BitField.Name: AHBP
BitField.Description: Accumulated Horizontal back porch (in units of pixel clock period) These bits define the Accumulated Horizontal back porch width which includes the Horizontal Synchronization and Horizontal back porch pixels minus 1. The Horizontal back porch is the period between Horizontal Synchronization going inactive and the start of the active display part of the next scan line.

BitField.Name: AVBP
BitField.Description: Accumulated Vertical back porch (in units of horizontal scan line) These bits define the accumulated Vertical back porch width which includes the Vertical Synchronization and Vertical back porch lines minus 1. The Vertical back porch is the number of horizontal scan lines at a start of frame to the start of the first active scan line of the next frame.

Register.Name: AWCR
Register.Description: LTDC Active Width Configuration Register This register defines the accumulated number of Horizontal Synchronization, back porch and Active pixels minus 1 (HSYNC width + HBP + Active Width - 1) and the accumulated number of Vertical Synchronization, back porch lines and Active lines minus 1 (VSYNC Height+ BVBP + Active Height - 1). Refer to Figure 82 and Section 16.4: LTDC programmable parameters for an example of configuration.

BitField.Name: AAW
BitField.Description: Accumulated Active Width (in units of pixel clock period) These bits define the Accumulated Active Width which includes the Horizontal Synchronization, Horizontal back porch and Active pixels minus 1. The Active Width is the number of pixels in active display area of the panel scan line. The maximum Active Width supported is 0x400.

BitField.Name: AAH
BitField.Description: Accumulated Active Height (in units of horizontal scan line) These bits define the Accumulated Height which includes the Vertical Synchronization, Vertical back porch and the Active Height lines minus 1. The Active Height is the number of active lines in the panel. The maximum Active Height supported is 0x300.

Register.Name: TWCR
Register.Description: LTDC Total Width Configuration Register This register defines the accumulated number of Horizontal Synchronization, back porch, Active and front porch pixels minus 1 (HSYNC Width + HBP + Active Width + HFP - 1) and the accumulated number of Vertical Synchronization, back porch lines, Active and Front lines minus 1 (VSYNC Height+ BVBP + Active Height + VFP - 1). Refer to Figure 82 and Section 16.4: LTDC programmable parameters for an example of configuration.

BitField.Name: TOTALW
BitField.Description: Total Width (in units of pixel clock period) These bits defines the accumulated Total Width which includes the Horizontal Synchronization, Horizontal back porch, Active Width and Horizontal front porch pixels minus 1.

BitField.Name: TOTALH
BitField.Description: Total Height (in units of horizontal scan line) These bits defines the accumulated Height which includes the Vertical Synchronization, Vertical back porch, the Active Height and Vertical front porch Height lines minus 1.

Register.Name: GCR
Register.Description: LTDC Global Control Register This register defines the global configuration of the LCD-TFT controller.

BitField.Name: HSPOL
BitField.Description: Horizontal Synchronization Polarity This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Horizontal Synchronization polarity is active low 1: Horizontal Synchronization polarity is active high

BitField.Name: VSPOL
BitField.Description: Vertical Synchronization Polarity This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Vertical Synchronization is active low 1: Vertical Synchronization is active high

BitField.Name: DEPOL
BitField.Description: Data Enable Polarity This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Data Enable polarity is active low 1: Data Enable polarity is active high

BitField.Name: PCPOL
BitField.Description: Pixel Clock Polarity This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: input pixel clock 1: inverted input pixel clock

BitField.Name: DEN
BitField.Description: Dither Enable This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Dither disable 1: Dither enable

BitField.Name: DRW
BitField.Description: Dither Red Width These bits return the Dither Red Bits

BitField.Name: DGW
BitField.Description: Dither Green Width These bits return the Dither Green Bits

BitField.Name: DBW
BitField.Description: Dither Blue Width These bits return the Dither Blue Bits

BitField.Name: LTDCEN
BitField.Description: LCD-TFT controller enable bit This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: LTDC disable 1: LTDC enable

Register.Name: SRCR
Register.Description: LTDC Shadow Reload Configuration Register This register allows to reload either immediately or during the vertical blanking period, the shadow registers values to the active registers. The shadow registers are all Layer 1 and Layer 2 registers except the LTDC_L1CLUTWR and the LTDC_L2CLUTWR. Note: The shadow registers read back the active values. Until the reload has been done, the 'old' value will be read.

BitField.Name: VBR
BitField.Description: Vertical Blanking Reload This bit is set by software and cleared only by hardware after reload. (it cannot be cleared through register write once it is set) 0: No effect 1: The shadow registers are reloaded during the vertical blanking period (at the beginning of the first line after the Active Display Area)

BitField.Name: IMR
BitField.Description: Immediate Reload This bit is set by software and cleared only by hardware after reload. 0: No effect 1: The shadow registers are reloaded immediately

Register.Name: BCCR
Register.Description: LTDC Background Color Configuration Register This register defines the background color (RGB888).

BitField.Name: BCRED
BitField.Description: Background Color Red value These bits configure the background red value

BitField.Name: BCGREEN
BitField.Description: Background Color Green value These bits configure the background green value

BitField.Name: BCBLUE
BitField.Description: Background Color Blue value These bits configure the background blue value

Register.Name: IER
Register.Description: LTDC Interrupt Enable Register This register determines which status flags generate an interrupt request by setting the corresponding bit to 1.

BitField.Name: RRIE
BitField.Description: Register Reload interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software 0: Register Reload interrupt disable 1: Register Reload interrupt enable

BitField.Name: TERRIE
BitField.Description: Transfer Error Interrupt Enable This bit is set and cleared by software 0: Transfer Error interrupt disable 1: Transfer Error interrupt enable

BitField.Name: FUIE
BitField.Description: FIFO Underrun Interrupt Enable This bit is set and cleared by software 0: FIFO Underrun interrupt disable 1: FIFO Underrun Interrupt enable

BitField.Name: LIE
BitField.Description: Line Interrupt Enable This bit is set and cleared by software 0: Line interrupt disable 1: Line Interrupt enable

Register.Name: ISR
Register.Description: LTDC Interrupt Status Register This register returns the interrupt status flag

BitField.Name: RRIF
BitField.Description: Register Reload Interrupt Flag 0: No Register Reload interrupt generated 1: Register Reload interrupt generated when a vertical blanking reload occurs (and the first line after the active area is reached)

BitField.Name: TERRIF
BitField.Description: Transfer Error interrupt flag 0: No Transfer Error interrupt generated 1: Transfer Error interrupt generated when a Bus error occurs

BitField.Name: FUIF
BitField.Description: FIFO Underrun Interrupt flag 0: NO FIFO Underrun interrupt generated. 1: A FIFO underrun interrupt is generated, if one of the layer FIFOs is empty and pixel data is read from the FIFO

BitField.Name: LIF
BitField.Description: Line Interrupt flag 0: No Line interrupt generated 1: A Line interrupt is generated, when a programmed line is reached

Register.Name: ICR
Register.Description: LTDC Interrupt Clear Register

BitField.Name: CRRIF
BitField.Description: Clears Register Reload Interrupt Flag 0: No effect 1: Clears the RRIF flag in the LTDC_ISR register

BitField.Name: CTERRIF
BitField.Description: Clears the Transfer Error Interrupt Flag 0: No effect 1: Clears the TERRIF flag in the LTDC_ISR register.

BitField.Name: CFUIF
BitField.Description: Clears the FIFO Underrun Interrupt flag 0: No effect 1: Clears the FUDERRIF flag in the LTDC_ISR register.

BitField.Name: CLIF
BitField.Description: Clears the Line Interrupt Flag 0: No effect 1: Clears the LIF flag in the LTDC_ISR register.

Register.Name: LIPCR
Register.Description: LTDC Line Interrupt Position Configuration Register This register defines the position of the line interrupt. The line value to be programmed depends on the timings parameters. Refer to Figure 82.

BitField.Name: LIPOS
BitField.Description: Line Interrupt Position These bits configure the line interrupt position

Register.Name: CPSR
Register.Description: LTDC Current Position Status Register This register defines the position of the line interrupt. The line value to be programmed depends on the timings parameters. Refer to Figure 82.

BitField.Name: CXPOS
BitField.Description: Current X Position These bits return the current X position

BitField.Name: CYPOS
BitField.Description: Current Y Position These bits return the current Y position

Register.Name: CDSR
Register.Description: LTDC Current Display Status Register This register returns the status of the current display phase which is controlled by the HSYNC, VSYNC, and Horizontal/Vertical DE signals. Example: if the current display phase is the vertical synchronization, the VSYNCS bit is set (active high). If the current display phase is the horizontal synchronization, the HSYNCS bit is active high.

BitField.Name: HSYNCS
BitField.Description: Horizontal Synchronization display Status 0: Active low 1: Active high

BitField.Name: VSYNCS
BitField.Description: Vertical Synchronization display Status 0: Active low 1: Active high

BitField.Name: HDES
BitField.Description: Horizontal Data Enable display Status 0: Active low 1: Active high

BitField.Name: VDES
BitField.Description: Vertical Data Enable display Status 0: Active low 1: Active high

Register.Name: L1CR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Control Register

BitField.Name: CLUTEN
BitField.Description: Color Look-Up Table Enable This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Color Look-Up Table disable 1: Color Look-Up Table enable The CLUT is only meaningful for L8, AL44 and AL88 pixel format. Refer to Color Look-Up Table (CLUT) on page 484

BitField.Name: COLKEN
BitField.Description: Color Keying Enable This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Color Keying disable 1: Color Keying enable

BitField.Name: LEN
BitField.Description: Layer Enable This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Layer disable 1: Layer enable

Register.Name: L2CR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Control Register

BitField.Name: CLUTEN
BitField.Description: Color Look-Up Table Enable This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Color Look-Up Table disable 1: Color Look-Up Table enable The CLUT is only meaningful for L8, AL44 and AL88 pixel format. Refer to Color Look-Up Table (CLUT) on page 484

BitField.Name: COLKEN
BitField.Description: Color Keying Enable This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Color Keying disable 1: Color Keying enable

BitField.Name: LEN
BitField.Description: Layer Enable This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Layer disable 1: Layer enable

Register.Name: L1WHPCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Window Horizontal Position Configuration Register This register defines the Horizontal Position (first and last pixel) of the layer 1 or 2 window. The first visible pixel of a line is the programmed value of AHBP[10:0] bits + 1 in the LTDC_BPCR register. Example: The LTDC_BPCR register is configured to 0x000E0005(AHBP[11:0] is 0xE) and the LTDC_AWCR register is configured to 0x028E01E5(AAW[11:0] is 0x28E). To configure the horizontal position of a window size of 630x460, with horizontal start offset of 5 pixels in the Active data area. 1. Layer window first pixel: WHSTPOS[11:0] should be programmed to 0x14 (0xE+1+0x5) 2. Layer window last pixel: WHSPPOS[11:0] should be programmed to 0x28A The last visible pixel of a line is the programmed value of AAW[10:0] bits in the LTDC_AWCR register. All values within this range are allowed.

BitField.Name: WHSPPOS
BitField.Description: Window Horizontal Stop Position These bits configure the last visible pixel of a line of the layer window.

BitField.Name: WHSTPOS
BitField.Description: Window Horizontal Start Position These bits configure the first visible pixel of a line of the layer window.

Register.Name: L2WHPCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Window Horizontal Position Configuration Register This register defines the Horizontal Position (first and last pixel) of the layer 1 or 2 window. The first visible pixel of a line is the programmed value of AHBP[10:0] bits + 1 in the LTDC_BPCR register. Example: The LTDC_BPCR register is configured to 0x000E0005(AHBP[11:0] is 0xE) and the LTDC_AWCR register is configured to 0x028E01E5(AAW[11:0] is 0x28E). To configure the horizontal position of a window size of 630x460, with horizontal start offset of 5 pixels in the Active data area. 1. Layer window first pixel: WHSTPOS[11:0] should be programmed to 0x14 (0xE+1+0x5) 2. Layer window last pixel: WHSPPOS[11:0] should be programmed to 0x28A The last visible pixel of a line is the programmed value of AAW[10:0] bits in the LTDC_AWCR register. All values within this range are allowed.

BitField.Name: WHSPPOS
BitField.Description: Window Horizontal Stop Position These bits configure the last visible pixel of a line of the layer window.

BitField.Name: WHSTPOS
BitField.Description: Window Horizontal Start Position These bits configure the first visible pixel of a line of the layer window.

Register.Name: L1WVPCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Window Vertical Position Configuration Register This register defines the vertical position (first and last line) of the layer1 or 2 window. The first visible line of a frame is the programmed value of AVBP[10:0] bits + 1 in the register LTDC_BPCR register. The last visible line of a frame is the programmed value of AAH[10:0] bits in the LTDC_AWCR register. All values within this range are allowed. Example: The LTDC_BPCR register is configured to 0x000E0005 (AVBP[10:0] is 0x5) and the LTDC_AWCR register is configured to 0x028E01E5 (AAH[10:0] is 0x1E5). To configure the vertical position of a window size of 630x460, with vertical start offset of 8 lines in the Active data area: 1. Layer window first line: WVSTPOS[10:0] should be programmed to 0xE (0x5 + 1 + 0x8) 2. Layer window last line: WVSPPOS[10:0] should be programmed to 0x1DA

BitField.Name: WVSPPOS
BitField.Description: Window Vertical Stop Position These bits configures the last visible line of the layer window.

BitField.Name: WVSTPOS
BitField.Description: Window Vertical Start Position These bits configure the first visible line of the layer window.

Register.Name: L2WVPCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Window Vertical Position Configuration Register This register defines the vertical position (first and last line) of the layer1 or 2 window. The first visible line of a frame is the programmed value of AVBP[10:0] bits + 1 in the register LTDC_BPCR register. The last visible line of a frame is the programmed value of AAH[10:0] bits in the LTDC_AWCR register. All values within this range are allowed. Example: The LTDC_BPCR register is configured to 0x000E0005 (AVBP[10:0] is 0x5) and the LTDC_AWCR register is configured to 0x028E01E5 (AAH[10:0] is 0x1E5). To configure the vertical position of a window size of 630x460, with vertical start offset of 8 lines in the Active data area: 1. Layer window first line: WVSTPOS[10:0] should be programmed to 0xE (0x5 + 1 + 0x8) 2. Layer window last line: WVSPPOS[10:0] should be programmed to 0x1DA

BitField.Name: WVSPPOS
BitField.Description: Window Vertical Stop Position These bits configures the last visible line of the layer window.

BitField.Name: WVSTPOS
BitField.Description: Window Vertical Start Position These bits configure the first visible line of the layer window.

Register.Name: L1CKCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Color Keying Configuration Register This register defines the color key value (RGB), which is used by the Color Keying.

BitField.Name: CKRED
BitField.Description: Color Key Red value

BitField.Name: CKGREEN
BitField.Description: Color Key Green value

BitField.Name: CKBLUE
BitField.Description: Color Key Blue value

Register.Name: L2CKCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Color Keying Configuration Register This register defines the color key value (RGB), which is used by the Color Keying.

BitField.Name: CKRED
BitField.Description: Color Key Red value

BitField.Name: CKGREEN
BitField.Description: Color Key Green value

BitField.Name: CKBLUE
BitField.Description: Color Key Blue value

Register.Name: L1PFCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Pixel Format Configuration Register This register defines the pixel format which is used for the stored data in the frame buffer of a layer. The pixel data is read from the frame buffer and then transformed to the internal format 8888 (ARGB).

BitField.Name: PF
BitField.Description: Pixel Format These bits configures the Pixel format 000: ARGB8888 001: RGB888 010: RGB565 011: ARGB1555 100: ARGB4444 101: L8 (8-Bit Luminance) 110: AL44 (4-Bit Alpha, 4-Bit Luminance) 111: AL88 (8-Bit Alpha, 8-Bit Luminance)

Register.Name: L2PFCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Pixel Format Configuration Register This register defines the pixel format which is used for the stored data in the frame buffer of a layer. The pixel data is read from the frame buffer and then transformed to the internal format 8888 (ARGB).

BitField.Name: PF
BitField.Description: Pixel Format These bits configures the Pixel format 000: ARGB8888 001: RGB888 010: RGB565 011: ARGB1555 100: ARGB4444 101: L8 (8-Bit Luminance) 110: AL44 (4-Bit Alpha, 4-Bit Luminance) 111: AL88 (8-Bit Alpha, 8-Bit Luminance)

Register.Name: L1CACR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Constant Alpha Configuration Register This register defines the constant alpha value (divided by 255 by Hardware), which is used in the alpha blending. Refer to LTDC_L1BFCR register.

BitField.Name: CONSTA
BitField.Description: Constant Alpha These bits configure the Constant Alpha used for blending. The Constant Alpha is divided by 255 by hardware. Example: if the programmed Constant Alpha is 0xFF, the Constant Alpha value is 255/255=1

Register.Name: L2CACR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Constant Alpha Configuration Register This register defines the constant alpha value (divided by 255 by Hardware), which is used in the alpha blending. Refer to LTDC_L2BFCR register.

BitField.Name: CONSTA
BitField.Description: Constant Alpha These bits configure the Constant Alpha used for blending. The Constant Alpha is divided by 255 by hardware. Example: if the programmed Constant Alpha is 0xFF, the Constant Alpha value is 255/255=1

Register.Name: L1DCCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Default Color Configuration Register This register defines the default color of a layer in the format ARGB. The default color is used outside the defined layer window or when a layer is disabled. The reset value of 0x00000000 defines a transparent black color.

BitField.Name: DCALPHA
BitField.Description: Default Color Alpha These bits configure the default alpha value

BitField.Name: DCRED
BitField.Description: Default Color Red These bits configure the default red value

BitField.Name: DCGREEN
BitField.Description: Default Color Green These bits configure the default green value

BitField.Name: DCBLUE
BitField.Description: Default Color Blue These bits configure the default blue value

Register.Name: L2DCCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Default Color Configuration Register This register defines the default color of a layer in the format ARGB. The default color is used outside the defined layer window or when a layer is disabled. The reset value of 0x00000000 defines a transparent black color.

BitField.Name: DCALPHA
BitField.Description: Default Color Alpha These bits configure the default alpha value

BitField.Name: DCRED
BitField.Description: Default Color Red These bits configure the default red value

BitField.Name: DCGREEN
BitField.Description: Default Color Green These bits configure the default green value

BitField.Name: DCBLUE
BitField.Description: Default Color Blue These bits configure the default blue value

Register.Name: L1BFCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Blending Factors Configuration Register This register defines the default color of a layer in the format ARGB. The default color is used outside the defined layer window or when a layer is disabled. The reset value of 0x00000000 defines a transparent black color.

BitField.Name: BF1
BitField.Description: Blending Factor 1 These bits select the blending factor F1 000: Reserved 001: Reserved 010: Reserved 011: Reserved 100: Constant Alpha 101: Reserved 110: Pixel Alpha x Constant Alpha 111:Reserved

BitField.Name: BF2
BitField.Description: Blending Factor 2 These bits select the blending factor F2 000: Reserved 001: Reserved 010: Reserved 011: Reserved 100: Reserved 101: 1 - Constant Alpha 110: Reserved 111: 1 - (Pixel Alpha x Constant Alpha)

Register.Name: L2BFCR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Blending Factors Configuration Register This register defines the default color of a layer in the format ARGB. The default color is used outside the defined layer window or when a layer is disabled. The reset value of 0x00000000 defines a transparent black color.

BitField.Name: BF1
BitField.Description: Blending Factor 1 These bits select the blending factor F1 000: Reserved 001: Reserved 010: Reserved 011: Reserved 100: Constant Alpha 101: Reserved 110: Pixel Alpha x Constant Alpha 111:Reserved

BitField.Name: BF2
BitField.Description: Blending Factor 2 These bits select the blending factor F2 000: Reserved 001: Reserved 010: Reserved 011: Reserved 100: Reserved 101: 1 - Constant Alpha 110: Reserved 111: 1 - (Pixel Alpha x Constant Alpha)

Register.Name: L1CFBAR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Color Frame Buffer Address Register This register defines the color frame buffer start address which has to point to the address where the pixel data of the top left pixel of a layer is stored in the frame buffer.

BitField.Name: CFBADD
BitField.Description: Color Frame Buffer Start Address These bits defines the color frame buffer start address.

Register.Name: L2CFBAR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Color Frame Buffer Address Register This register defines the color frame buffer start address which has to point to the address where the pixel data of the top left pixel of a layer is stored in the frame buffer.

BitField.Name: CFBADD
BitField.Description: Color Frame Buffer Start Address These bits defines the color frame buffer start address.

Register.Name: L1CFBLR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 Color Frame Buffer Length Register This register defines the color frame buffer line length and pitch. Example: • A frame buffer having the format RGB565 (2 bytes per pixel) and a width of 256 pixels (total number of bytes per line is 256x2=512 bytes), where pitch = line length requires a value of 0x02000203 to be written into this register. • A frame buffer having the format RGB888 (3 bytes per pixel) and a width of 320 pixels (total number of bytes per line is 320x3=960), where pitch = line length requires a value of 0x03C003C3 to be written into this register.

BitField.Name: CFBP
BitField.Description: Color Frame Buffer Pitch in bytes These bits define the pitch which is the increment from the start of one line of pixels to the start of the next line in bytes.

BitField.Name: CFBLL
BitField.Description: Color Frame Buffer Line Length These bits define the length of one line of pixels in bytes + 3. The line length is computed as follows: Active high width x number of bytes per pixel + 3.

Register.Name: L2CFBLR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 Color Frame Buffer Length Register This register defines the color frame buffer line length and pitch. Example: • A frame buffer having the format RGB565 (2 bytes per pixel) and a width of 256 pixels (total number of bytes per line is 256x2=512 bytes), where pitch = line length requires a value of 0x02000203 to be written into this register. • A frame buffer having the format RGB888 (3 bytes per pixel) and a width of 320 pixels (total number of bytes per line is 320x3=960), where pitch = line length requires a value of 0x03C003C3 to be written into this register.

BitField.Name: CFBP
BitField.Description: Color Frame Buffer Pitch in bytes These bits define the pitch which is the increment from the start of one line of pixels to the start of the next line in bytes.

BitField.Name: CFBLL
BitField.Description: Color Frame Buffer Line Length These bits define the length of one line of pixels in bytes + 3. The line length is computed as follows: Active high width x number of bytes per pixel + 3.

Register.Name: L1CFBLNR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 ColorFrame Buffer Line Number Register This register defines the number of lines in the color frame buffer. Note: The number of lines and line length settings define how much data is fetched per frame for every layer. If it is configured to less bytes than required, a FIFO underrun interrupt will be generated if enabled. The start address and pitch settings on the other hand define the correct start of every line in memory.

BitField.Name: CFBLNBR
BitField.Description: Frame Buffer Line Number These bits define the number of lines in the frame buffer which corresponds to the Active high width.

Register.Name: L2CFBLNR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 ColorFrame Buffer Line Number Register This register defines the number of lines in the color frame buffer. Note: The number of lines and line length settings define how much data is fetched per frame for every layer. If it is configured to less bytes than required, a FIFO underrun interrupt will be generated if enabled. The start address and pitch settings on the other hand define the correct start of every line in memory.

BitField.Name: CFBLNBR
BitField.Description: Frame Buffer Line Number These bits define the number of lines in the frame buffer which corresponds to the Active high width.

Register.Name: L1CLUTWR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 1 CLUT Write Register This register defines the CLUT address and the RGB value. Note: The CLUT write register should only be configured during blanking period or if the layer is disabled. The CLUT can be enabled or disabled in the LTDC_LxCR register. The CLUT is only meaningful for L8, AL44 and AL88 pixel format.

BitField.Name: CLUTADD
BitField.Description: CLUT Address These bits configure the CLUT address (color position within the CLUT) of each RGB value

BitField.Name: RED
BitField.Description: Red value These bits configure the red value

BitField.Name: GREEN
BitField.Description: Green value These bits configure the green value

BitField.Name: BLUE
BitField.Description: Blue value These bits configure the blue value

Register.Name: L2CLUTWR
Register.Description: LTDC Layer 2 CLUT Write Register This register defines the CLUT address and the RGB value. Note: The CLUT write register should only be configured during blanking period or if the layer is disabled. The CLUT can be enabled or disabled in the LTDC_LxCR register. The CLUT is only meaningful for L8, AL44 and AL88 pixel format.

BitField.Name: CLUTADD
BitField.Description: CLUT Address These bits configure the CLUT address (color position within the CLUT) of each RGB value

BitField.Name: RED
BitField.Description: Red value These bits configure the red value

BitField.Name: GREEN
BitField.Description: Green value These bits configure the green value

BitField.Name: BLUE
BitField.Description: Blue value These bits configure the blue value
